metadata.name: Azure NetApp Files Capacity Pool Volumes
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure NetApp Files Capacity Pool Volume.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Conditional. The name of the parent NetApp account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent capacity pool. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the pool volume.
Optional. Location of the pool volume.
Required. If enabled (true) the pool can contain cool Access enabled volumes.
Required. Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered.
Optional. Determines the data retrieval behavior from the cool tier to standard storage based on the read pattern for cool access enabled volumes (Default/Never/Read).
Required. The source of the encryption key.
Optional. The resource ID of the key vault private endpoint.
Optional. Indicates whether the local volume is the source or destination for the Volume Replication (src/dst).
Optional. The remote region for the other end of the Volume Replication.
Optional. The resource ID of the remote volume.
Required. The replication schedule for the volume.
Optional. The type of the volume. DataProtection volumes are used for replication.
Optional. Zone where the volume will be placed.
Optional. If Backup policy is enforced.
Optional. The pool service level. Must match the one of the parent capacity pool.
Optional. Network feature for the volume.

Optional. A unique file path for the volume. This is the name of the volume export. A volume is mounted using the export path. File path must start with an alphabetical character and be unique within the subscription.
Required. Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes.
Optional. Set of protocol types.
Required. The Azure Resource URI for a delegated subnet. Must have the delegation Microsoft.NetApp/volumes.
Optional. Export policy rules.
Optional. The name of the snapshot policy to link.
Optional. The name of the backup policy to link.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. The resource Id of the Backup Vault.
Optional. Boolean to enable replication.
